Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui

Class UIConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui.UIConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.eclipse.rap.rwt.Adaptable
    public class UIConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.eclipse.rap.rwt.Adaptable, java.io.Serializable

    A Tabris UI consists of Page and Action objects that are loosely coupled. The point where these are hooked together is a UIConfiguration.

    Two types of pages exist. These are top level pages and normal pages. A top level page marks the beginning of an application flow. E.g. when you developing a book browsing app the top level page may be your shelf from where you can browse the books. Of course in such an app you will need to browse from a book to another book without the way back to the shelf. This means the book page needs to be a normal pages that can be chained together.
    This is what normal pages are, the second type of pages. They can appear everywhere in the application. The depth level of such a page is not defined.

    To add pages you need to add a PageConfiguration to a UIConfiguration. In the PageConfiguration you can define the type of the page.

    Actions also exist in two types. The first type are global actions. Global actions are visible in the whole application regardless on which page you are currently on. The other type of actions are page actions. These actions are having the same lifecycle as a Page and they are also only visible when the related page is visible.

    You can add Actions similar as Pages. To add a global Action you need to add it directly to a UIConfiguration. To add a page action you need to add it to a PageConfiguration.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    PageConfiguration, Page, ActionConfiguration, Action, TransitionListener, Serialized Form

      • addPageConfiguration

        public UIConfiguration addPageConfiguration​(PageConfiguration configuration)

        Adds a page represented by a PageConfiguration object.

        Since:
        1.0

      • getPageConfiguration

        public PageConfiguration getPageConfiguration​(java.lang.String pageId)

        Returns a PageConfiguration for the passed in id or null if no PageConfiguration exist for this id. The PageConfiguration can be used to manipulate a page during runtime e.g. adding ActionConfigurations.

        Returns:
        The PageConfiguration for the specified id or null when the configuration does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pageId is null or empty.
        Since:
        1.2

      • removePageConfiguration

        public UIConfiguration removePageConfiguration​(java.lang.String pageId)

        Removes a PageConfiguration for the specified id. Can be used to manipulate a ui during runtime.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the page to remove is active or in the current page chain.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the id is null or empty.
        Since:
        1.2

      • addActionConfiguration

        public UIConfiguration addActionConfiguration​(ActionConfiguration configuration)

        Adds a global action represented by an ActionConfiguration object.

        Since:
        1.0

      • removeActionConfiguration

        public UIConfiguration removeActionConfiguration​(java.lang.String actionConfigurationId)

        Removes an ActionConfiguration for the specified id. Can be used to manipulate a page during runtime.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no ActionConfiguration exist for the specified id.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the id is null or empty.
        Since:
        1.2
